intro: Angadenia havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban angadenia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
